title: Java Streams API
subject: Java
theory:
A sequence of elements supporting sequential and parallel aggregate operations.
**Not** I/O streams.

Pipeline: Source -> Filter -> Map -> Collect.

common_mistakes.correction: Streams are closed after terminal operation. You cannot reuse them.
common_mistakes.example: Exception: stream has already been operated upon or closed.

interview_questions.question: Difference between map() and flatMap()?
interview_questions.answer: Map processes 1 element gives 1 element. FlatMap processes 1 element gives Stream (flattens nested lists).

real_world_use_cases.description: Filtering users by age, mapping to emails, and collecting to list.

exam_notes: Lazy Evaluation: Intermediate ops run only when Terminal op is called.
summary: Streams are the modern way to process collections.
